disobedience.question: Have I rejected the unity of the Church through negative thoughts when frustrated with its members?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did I mock the Church?

uncharity.question: Did I fail to show patience with others when faced with frustration or difficulty?

theft.question:
Did you help others steal? 

Consider the scenario where, while walking around a local market, festival or shopping area with friends or in your community, you came across an item that was being given away for free by its owner. While everyone else was taking the item without saying anything to the person who owned it, you helped your friend take this item.
theft.description: While not stealing yourself, this sin still participates in breaking the seventh commandment and shows disregard for others' rightful property and dignity.

ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: over the well - being of others
ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence the way I approach decision-making and leadership roles, potentially leading me to prioritize self-interest over the well-being of others?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make accumulating wealth, possessions, or material goods a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I let the desire for material comfort and security become an excessive driving force in my life, leading me to make accumulation of wealth a primary concern over my relationship with God?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

oppression.question: Have I mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others through my deeds?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Have I mistreated, harassed, or discriminated against others through my deeds?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: to mere objects of my curiosity
rather than treating them as fully realized human beings
lust.question: Did I reduce others to mere objects of my curiosity, rather than treating them as fully realized human beings?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

extracted_data_phrases: to their utility , value , or usefulness
rather than seeing them as fully human individuals

extracted_data_phrases: to my own abilities and efforts
rather than acknowledging God 's providence in my life
autonomy.question: Did I take things for granted, attributing their source to my own abilities and efforts rather than acknowledging God's providence in my life?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the successes in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

presumption.question: Did I assume that my accomplishments and successes in life were solely due to my own efforts, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence in guiding me?
presumption.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would lose their blessings so that mine could seem greater in comparison?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in using words that offended others
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in using words that offended others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in using words that dishonored others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing rumors or private information about others through conversations, even if what was shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I use my workday for purposes other than rest, worship, and relaxation on a day that could have been otherwise avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).
